definition: to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
proud/arrogant/to despise/unyielding/to defy
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
outstanding talent (idiom)/incomparable artistic merit/accomplishment out of the ordinary

sentences.english: For centuries, Chinese wealth and power dwarfed the West’s.
sentences.chinese: 在好几个世纪里，中国的财富和权势傲视西方。

sentences.english: You for You have the right or rich parents and despising?
sentences.chinese: 你为有钱有权的父母而傲视吗？

sentences.english: Which one not reaching the top of a successful person heart undoubtedly the swagger?
sentences.chinese: 哪一个登上成功顶峰的人心中没有傲视群雄的霸气？

sentences.english: In the fierce market competition, the way film and television production companies are expanding.
sentences.chinese: 在激烈的市场竞争中，傲视影视制作公司不断扩大。

sentences.english: The ready-made garments industry is thriving, surpassed globally only by China and Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 成衣产业在全世界位列中国和土耳其之后傲视全球。

sentences.english: North Sea Scenic area is at the center of Huangshan. It boasts many famous scenes.
sentences.chinese: 北海景区在黄山的中心，它的美可以傲视群景。

sentences.english: I often condescending, disdain for everything, gesticulating at home.
sentences.chinese: 我常常居高临下，傲视一切，在家里指手划脚。

sentences.english: Our product is in the lead in this industry.
sentences.chinese: 我们的产品在这个业界傲视群雄。

sentences.english: From a proud tower in the town, death looks gigantically down.
sentences.chinese: 死亡站在高塔上，傲视着下面的一切。

sentences.english: Personality self life attitude, despising the high pace of urban life.
sentences.chinese: 个性自我的生活态度，傲视高节奏的都市生活。

sentences.english: As yet, the market share of Microsoft has remained unrivalled among its competitors.
sentences.chinese: 迄今，微软的市场占有率依然傲视群雄。

sentences.english: He is truly a great man boast of Qianfeng Wanhe.
sentences.chinese: 他是真正傲视千峰万壑的伟人。

unsurpassed/unparalleled
